alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula Inland; Ashtabula Lakeshore (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued November 16 at 11:11AM EST until November 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches expected in the most persistent lake effect snows. The highest snowfall totals are expected in the northern half of the county, especially near Interstate 90. * WHERE...Ashtabula Inland and Ashtabula Lakeshore counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM EST this evening to 10 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect snow will develop late this afternoon into this evening. Snow will increase in intensity overnight tonight, when snowfall rates will increase to one inch per hour or greater. Snow will wane in intensity during the day Thursday, before the most organized snow bands start lifting north over the lake by Thursday evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
